'''Al-Gama'a''' ({{lang-ar|Ø§ÙØ¬ÙØ§Ø¹Ø©}}) is a [[Egypt|Egyptian]] [[Drama]], [[Historical drama film|Historical]], and [[Political drama]] series written by [[Wahid Hamid]] and directed by [[Mohammed Yasin]] and the production of [[Kamel Abu Ali]] began filming in the series in January [[2010]] with a budget of 50 million Egyptian pounds <ref name="Egyptian Censorship allows the series "Al-Gama'a" without any comments">[http://www.egypty.com/art-details.aspx?art=5255 Egyptian Censorship allows the series "Al-Gama'a" without any comments]</ref>. The Show deals with the rise of the [[Muslim Brotherhood]], Egyptâs largest [[Islamist|Islamist political group]], and it's founder '''[[Hasan Al-Banna]]'''. The Muslim Brotherhood that is banned but tolerated in [[Egypt]]. While the production is impeccable, critics have pouted at the blatant pro-government stance of the show, saying that it is getting audiences ready for [[Egyptian parliamentary election, 2010|upcoming parliamentary elections later this year]], in which Muslim Brotherhood members enjoyed great success in the election before because of the charitable contributions they make to their communities<ref name="It is tradition that makes holy month memorable">[http://www.thenational.ae/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20100828/WEEKENDER/708279835/1080/NATIONAL It is tradition that makes holy month memorable]</ref>.
+
'''Al-Gama'a''' ({{lang-ar|Ø§ÙØ¬ÙØ§Ø¹Ø©}}) is a [[Egypt|Egyptian]] [[Drama]], [[Historical drama film|Historical]], and [[Political drama]] series written by [[Wahid Hamid]] and directed by [[Mohammed Yasin]] and the production of [[Kamel Abu Ali]] began filming in the series in January [[2010]] with a budget of 50 million Egyptian pounds <ref name="Egyptian Censorship allows the series ''Al-Gama'a'' without any comments">[http://www.egypty.com/art-details.aspx?art=5255 Egyptian Censorship allows the series ''Al-Gama'a'' without any comments]</ref>. The Show deals with the rise of the [[Muslim Brotherhood]], Egyptâs largest [[Islamist|Islamist political group]], and it's founder '''[[Hasan Al-Banna]]'''. The Muslim Brotherhood that is banned but tolerated in [[Egypt]]. While the production is impeccable, critics have pouted at the blatant pro-government stance of the show, saying that it is getting audiences ready for [[Egyptian parliamentary election, 2010|upcoming parliamentary elections later this year]], in which Muslim Brotherhood members enjoyed great success in the election before because of the charitable contributions they make to their communities<ref name="It is tradition that makes holy month memorable">[http://www.thenational.ae/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20100828/WEEKENDER/708279835/1080/NATIONAL It is tradition that makes holy month memorable]</ref>.
== Production ==
== Production ==
â
Series was filmed in the [[Egyptian Media Production City|Media Production City]] and in [[Heliopolis (Cairo suburb)|Heliopolis]] in [[Cairo|Cairo]]<ref name="Egyptian Censorship allows the series "Al-Gama'a" without any comments"></ref> and several other Egyptian governorates and the entire series was filmed in Egypt<ref>[http://www.masreat.com/%D9%85%D8%B3%D9%84%D8%B3%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AC%D9%85%D8%A7%D8%B9%D8%A9/ Al-Gama'a (TV series) - the largest Artistic work done about the Muslim Brotherhood]</ref>.
+
Series was filmed in the [[Egyptian Media Production City|Media Production City]] and in [[Heliopolis (Cairo suburb)|Heliopolis]] in [[Cairo|Cairo]]<ref name="Egyptian Censorship allows the series ''Al-Gama'a'' without any comments"></ref> and several other Egyptian governorates and the entire series was filmed in Egypt<ref>[http://www.masreat.com/%D9%85%D8%B3%D9%84%D8%B3%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AC%D9%85%D8%A7%D8%B9%D8%A9/ Al-Gama'a (TV series) - the largest Artistic work done about the Muslim Brotherhood]</ref>.
